<p> MovieTexture applies a 2D movie image to surface geometry, or provides audio for a Sound node. First define as texture, then USE as Sound source to see it/hear it/save memory. Texture maps have a 2D coordinate system (s, t) horizontal and vertical, with (s, t) texture-coordinate values in range [0.0, 1.0] for opposite corners of the image. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Appearance" target="_blank">Appearance</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#MovieTexture" target="_blank">MovieTexture</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Sound" target="_blank">Sound</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/texturing.html" target="_blank">18 Texturing component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/texturing.html#Concepts" target="_blank">18.2 Concepts</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/texturing.html#MovieTexture" target="_blank">18.4.2 MovieTexture</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/texturing.html#Sound" target="_blank">16.4.2 Sound</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter17Textures" target="_blank">Chapter 17 Textures</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter05AppearanceMaterialTextures" target="_blank">Chapter 5 Appearance Material Textures</a> </li> </ul>
